content.question: Selected values of a continuous function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are given in the table above. What is the fewest possible number of zeros of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> in the interval <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma 5, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: Zero, because <math alttext="f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> is not equal to 0 for any of the values in the table.

One, because <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is continuous on the interval <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma 5, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="f of 0, is greater than 0, which is greater than f of 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn><mo>></mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Two, because the values for <math alttext="f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> in the table change from positive to negative twice.

Three, because <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is continuous on the interval <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma 5, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="f of 0, is greater than 0, which is greater than f of 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn><mo>></mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="f of 1, is less than 0, which is less than f of 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="f of 3, is greater than 0, which is greater than f of 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn><mo>></mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: Three, because <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is continuous on the interval <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma 5, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="f of 0, is greater than 0, which is greater than f of 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn><mo>></mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="f of 1, is less than 0, which is less than f of 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="f of 3, is greater than 0, which is greater than f of 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn><mo>></mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.
